adrFormatAddress: 870 7th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

originalText.text:
Please work on customer service. I waited for 15 minutes on a mobile order I received 3 out 4 items right away. I told them I was missing oatmeal. The barista let the others know then the cashier started to make it but the other barista told him to stay on cash register the young lady handling the food seemed to be making all the sandwiches so when o asked her about my oat meal she caught an attitude grab the oatmeal put in a bag the tossed it on the counter and without any of the toppings! No need for the had done job with an attitude. I told the cashier and he politely gave me the topping.

*notice time stamp for 10:37 am I didn’t get it till 10:54. Everything else was there and ready.

originalText.text:
When I first walked into this Starbucks I thought they had The Artist's Garden painting by Monet on loan from the Musée d'Orsay in Paris. Or perhaps it was done by one of his understudies... ? or maybe it was an unattributed Monet? Is this "Who the $&% Is Jackson Pollock?" all over again?!
For the uninitiated, that's a documentary that follows Teri Horton, a 73-year-old long-haul truck driver from California, who purchased a painting from a thrift shop for $5, only to find out later that it may be a Jackson Pollock painting. She had no clue at the time who Jackson Pollock was, hence the name of the film. She ends up turning down a $9 million offer for the painting, as she thought it was worth closer to $50 million. She died without having sold it. Pure insanity, but a great watch nonetheless.

Anyways not sure how we got here but I wish the service was as good as the Monet imitation painting. I felt like I was pulling teeth asking to get a tall cold brew and a Marshmallow Dream Bar... 3 stars though because of the painting and the dream bar did indeed slap.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

originalText.text: Staff was extremely rude. I ordered and waited for my drink and a barista Called my name to come up to her to get my drink when I did, I was asking where my drink was because I did not see it when she called me over. There was a drink sitting and I assumed was mine since it was the only one there I asked the barista “is this my drink?” She nodded. I asked again “my drink?” Again nodded, when she was going to hand it to me I just thought since she wasn’t gonna give it to me after confirming it was mine to just grab it then but when I tried another barista rudely yelled at me and said “do not grab anything over the bar!” I was confused since the first barista said it was my drink twice and no one handed it to me. They put my drink in a different area and didn’t even tell me where it was until after that. Wish I got names to report to cooperate but this will do. Wish I could give a 0 for my experience for the very unfriendly and snooty workers.

originalText.text: The manager wouldn't exchange 5 dollars for singles. The employees making drinks and food were very courteous. I understand that the business wouldn't suffer, but customer service needs work at the managerial level.

text.text: The manager wouldn't exchange 5 dollars for singles. The employees making drinks and food were very courteous. I understand that the business wouldn't suffer, but customer service needs work at the managerial level.

originalText.text: Was surprised to how friendly and attentive the staff was at this location, enough so I felt like I needed to write this review. My expectations are always low in a Manhattan Starbucks but couldn’t believe how not only nice the people working here were but how efficiently I got my order. The person taking my order was kind and even when they stepped away they informed me they would be right back to help me. Someone that seemed to be a manager even said hello. Got my order in less then 5 minutes and with a smile. Tables were clean and wasn’t super crowded on a Tuesday afternoon.
